title: The Stoic Mind
subtitle: A Visual Exploration of Stoic Philosophy

intro.title: About This Book
paragraphs: The Stoic Mind is a visual guide that connects ancient Stoic wisdom to modern life. Through 25 chapters, it offers practical principles for navigating work, relationships, and personal growth with resilience and inner peace. Each chapter presents a core Stoic insight paired with actionable advice for the challenges we face today.
This mind map presents the book's teachings in an accessible format, helping you internalize and apply timeless philosophical wisdom to your daily life.

epigraph.quote: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
epigraph.author: Marcus Aurelius

chapters.title: Work is a Subset of Life, Not a Superset
chapters.description: Understanding the Stoic perspective on work-life balance and keeping your priorities aligned with what truly matters.

chapters.title: Change What You're Doing, to Change Where You're Going
chapters.description: The power of deliberate actions and choices in shaping your destiny and adapting to inevitable change.

chapters.title: First Do It, Then Do It Right, Then Do It Better
chapters.description: The importance of initiating action, refining processes, and striving for continuous improvement.

chapters.title: Confidence is Calm. Ego Makes a Lot of Noise
chapters.description: Exploring the dichotomy between true confidence and ego, guided by the Stoic principle of self-awareness.

chapters.title: Speak Confidently as if You Are Right, But Listen Carefully as if You Are Wrong
chapters.description: The art of effective communication, listening, and learning, grounded in Stoic humility.

chapters.title: Argue Less, Persuade More
chapters.subtitle: Persuasion is an Art That Requires a Paintbrush, Not a Sledgehammer
chapters.description: Mastering the gentle art of influence without confrontation or force.

chapters.title: Experience Creates Wisdom. Wisdom Creates Confidence. Confidence Creates Success

chapters.title: Consistency Does Not Require Perfection
chapters.description: Embracing imperfect progress over paralyzed perfectionism.

chapters.title: The Lesson is More Important Than the Mistake
chapters.description: Transforming setbacks into stepping stones through a growth-oriented mindset.

chapters.title: Don't Count on Motivation. Count on Discipline
chapters.subtitle: You Won't Be Motivated Every Day — And That's Okay
chapters.description: Why discipline outperforms motivation as a reliable driver of success.

chapters.title: Focus on What You Can Control
chapters.subtitle: You Don't Need More Time, You Need More Focus
chapters.description: The Stoic dichotomy of control and the power of directed attention.

chapters.title: Discipline is Not About Perfection. It's About Continuity
chapters.description: Building sustainable habits through steady, imperfect practice.

chapters.title: In the Age of Distraction, Focus is a Superpower

chapters.title: Be Consistent
chapters.subtitle: Motivation May Ignite the Spark, But Consistency Fuels the Flame
chapters.description: The compound effect of showing up day after day.

chapters.title: Perseverance is One of the Keys to Success
chapters.subtitle: Many Winners Are Just the Last Ones Standing
chapters.description: Why outlasting obstacles matters more than outrunning them.

chapters.title: Step Outside Your Comfort Zone
chapters.subtitle: It Feels Scary Because It's Unfamiliar, Not Because You're Incapable

chapters.title: You Haven't Started Because You Are Afraid to Fail
chapters.subtitle: You Are Already Failing Because You Haven't Started
chapters.description: Breaking the paralysis of fear through the Stoic lens of action.

chapters.title: Find a Way to Play the Game That Ensures You Get a Lot of Shots

chapters.title: Don't Measure Your Life with Someone Else's Ruler

chapters.title: Success and Failure Exist on a Continuum

chapters.title: Success is Not About Meeting Someone Else's Expectations
chapters.subtitle: It's About Living Up to Yours
chapters.description: Aligning achievement with your authentic values and standards.

chapters.title: Own Your Calendar. Define Your Day. Or Others Will

chapters.title: Change the Way You Speak About Yourself and You Can Change Your Life
chapters.description: The transformative power of self-talk and internal narrative.

chapters.title: A Bad Day, That's It. Not a Bad Life
chapters.subtitle: Zooming Out Gives a Lot of Perspective
chapters.description: Maintaining perspective when challenges feel overwhelming.

chapters.title: Create Hard, Recover Harder
chapters.subtitle: Taking Time to Rest Well Means You Can Keep Creating Sustainably
chapters.description: The Stoic wisdom of sustainable effort and intentional rest.

keyTeachings.description: Focus your energy only on what you can influence — your thoughts, actions, and responses
Build systems and habits that don't depend on fleeting feelings
Consistent imperfect action beats paralyzed perfectionism
Measure your life by your own values, not external expectations
Every setback contains a lesson; every obstacle is an opportunity
Balance intense effort with intentional recovery for long-term success
